latest_week.brief_summary: Seven PRs merged covering GC improvements, Unix API modernization, and C callback safety fixes
latest_week.new_features_summary: Unix library socket API modernization and runtime improvements for GC pacing and callback safety
latest_week.new_features:
- **Unix library socket API modernization** by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) deprecating `union sock_addr_union` in favor of standard `struct sockaddr_storage` and `socklen_param_type` in favor of `socklen_t`, with backward compatibility macros for C and C++ ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310))
- **Runtime callback safety fix** preventing segfaults by ensuring C callback mechanism properly calls `caml_continuation_use` when handling continuations, addressing dropped continuation issues ([#14337](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14337))
- **GC ephemeron accounting improvements** removing quadratic term from ephemeron marking work calculation to improve garbage collection pacing accuracy ([#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336))
- **GC work accounting fixes** correcting domain-local work counter tracking for mark and sweep phases to prevent pacing logic errors ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- **Runtime header improvements** making `<caml/osdeps.h>` self-standing by adding necessary includes, improving C extension compatibility ([#14342](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14342))
latest_week.activity_summary: Newly opened PR for ephemeron marking fix, ongoing work on relocatable OCaml and multicore class initialization
latest_week.activity:
- **Newly opened PR** by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) fixing ephemeron marking edge case in `major_gc.c` ([#14338](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14338))
- **Multicore class initialization** work continues with [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) proposing atomic accesses for class cache read/write operations to address race conditions, with discussion about whether to pursue mutex-based approach instead ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- **Relocatable OCaml** initiative by [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) progressing with five active PRs covering opam integration, search/suffix handling, relative libdir configuration, and explicit-relative paths in `ld.conf` ([#14246](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14246), [#14245](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14245), [#14244](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14244), [#14243](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14243), [#14250](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14250))
- **Spellchecking hints** for module error messages by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) under review with discussion about implementation approach ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330))
- **Haiku native backend** activation work by [Anarchos](https://github.com/Sylvain78) continuing with platform-specific changes ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- **Include functor** feature proposal by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) allowing functor inclusion syntax ([#14177](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14177))
- **CI infrastructure updates** including migration to macOS 15 images ([#14339](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14339)) and C++ compiler installation for Cygwin testing ([#14347](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14347))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Discussion on string search functions for the String module
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **String search API proposal** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) discussing potential additions for substring search functionality to the standard library String module ([#14099](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14099))
- **Multicore class initialization safety** discussion involving [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls), [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche), and [Nathan Taylor](https://github.com/dijkstracula) about whether atomic operations or mutex-based locking is the right approach for thread-safe class initialization ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))
- **Unix socket API deprecation** conversation led by [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) and [@shym](https://github.com/shym) about migration path from non-standard types to POSIX standard `sockaddr_storage` and `socklen_t` ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on runtime safety and modernization with Unix API updates and GC pacing improvements
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Runtime safety hardening** with fixes for continuation handling in C callbacks and proper GC work accounting to prevent crashes and improve multicore stability
- **API modernization** moving Unix library toward standard POSIX types while maintaining backward compatibility through C11 `_Generic` macros and C++ overloading
- **GC pacing refinements** continuing work on accurate work accounting for ephemerons and domain-local operations to improve garbage collection performance
- **Platform support expansion** with ongoing Haiku native backend work and CI infrastructure updates for macOS 15
latest_week.contributors_summary: Active contributions from Antonin Décimo (Unix API), Damien Doligez (GC), Max Slater (callbacks), and David Allsopp (CI/relocatable)
latest_week.contributors:
- [Antonin Décimo](https://github.com/MisterDA) led Unix library modernization merging three PRs including socket API deprecation ([#14310](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14310)), self-standing osdeps.h header ([#14342](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14342)), and macOS 15 CI migration ([#14339](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14339))
- [Damien Doligez](https://github.com/damiendoligez) improved GC pacing with ephemeron accounting fixes ([#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336)) and work counter corrections ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))
- [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) fixed continuation handling bug in C callback mechanism preventing potential segfaults ([#14337](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14337))
- [David Allsopp](https://github.com/dra27) merged C++ compiler CI fix ([#14347](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14347)), opened test skip issue ([#14348](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14348)), and continued relocatable OCaml work
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) opened ephemeron marking fix PR ([#14338](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14338)) and provided reviews on GC changes ([#14336](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14336), [#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329)), class cache atomics ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333)), and spellchecking hints ([#14330](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14330))
- [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) proposed atomic class cache operations and participated in multicore safety discussions ([#14333](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14333))

- [Austin Theriault](https://github.com/ajbt200128) reported two Memprof-related segfault issues ([#14341](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14341), [#14340](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14340))
- [@lost22git](https://github.com/lost22git) reported getentropy build issue on Termux ([#14346](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14346))
- [Victoire](https://github.com/lupjo) requested documentation update for effect keyword ([#14345](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14345))
- [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) reported and saw resolved toploop constructor binding issue ([#14344](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14344))
- [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) reported type inclusion check incompleteness ([#14343](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14343))
- [@Sylvain78](https://github.com/Sylvain78) continued Haiku native backend work ([#14138](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14138))
- [@stedolan](https://github.com/stedolan) provided review feedback on GC work accounting ([#14329](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/14329))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Five PRs merged including new Thread.set_current_thread_name API and compiler improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New Thread.set_current_thread_name function for setting thread names on supported platforms
oldest_week.new_features:
- New **Thread.set_current_thread_name** function allows setting thread names from within thread functions, available on most systems that support the functionality ([#13504](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13504))
- **Documentation improvements** for `-safe-string` option clarification in Bytes module interface explaining immutability invariant protection ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **GC verbose flag documentation** reformatted with cleaner hexadecimal notation (0x001 instead of 0x0001) in Gc.control interface ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
- **String.to_seq documentation** enhanced to clarify behavior in "unsafe-string" mode where modifications during iteration are reflected in sequence ([1e5d73946f](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/commit/1e5d73946f8f1074afeffbf155869ed9a0ff70ef))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Core compiler maintenance with runtime events, typing improvements, and documentation updates
oldest_week.activity:
- **Runtime events enhancement** by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with addition of `Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR` event for better garbage collection monitoring ([#13407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13407))
- **Memory documentation improvement** by [@andyhhp](https://github.com/andyhhp) adding discussion of `CAMLnoreturn` attribute usage in memory.h header ([#13561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13561))
- **Local module type substitution fix** by [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) addressing issue [#13388](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13388) where local substitution could fail ([#13540](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13540))
- **Manual clarification** by [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) disambiguating the `-with-runtime` option documentation ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))
- **Testsuite cleanup** by [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions for better js_of_ocaml compatibility ([#13550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13550))
- **Ongoing modular explicits development** with [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continuing work on [#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275), a feature for module-parametrized functions enabling convenient abstraction over higher-kinded types
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors delivered threading, runtime, and documentation improvements
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) implemented the `Runtime_events.EV_EMPTY_MINOR` event for improved garbage collection monitoring ([#13407](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13407))
- [@andyhhp](https://github.com/andyhhp) enhanced runtime documentation by adding comprehensive discussion of the `CAMLnoreturn` attribute in memory.h ([#13561](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13561))
- [@Octachron](https://github.com/Octachron) fixed a typing system issue where local module type substitution could fail in certain contexts ([#13540](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13540))
- [@OlivierNicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) improved compiler documentation by disambiguating the manual description of the `-with-runtime` option ([#12912](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/12912))
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) cleaned up testsuite code by removing unnecessary string-bytes conversions that interfered with js_of_ocaml compatibility ([#13550](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13550))
- [Samuel Vivien](https://github.com/samsa1) continued development on modular explicits feature ([#13275](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml/issues/13275)), receiving community feedback and working on implementation improvements

latest_week.brief_summary: Release preparation week with cmdliner vendoring, OCaml 5.5 support, and long-standing macOS sandbox fix
latest_week.new_features_summary: macOS sandbox improvements, version-equivalent package rename fix, AppArmor abi/4.0 check, release tarball fixes
latest_week.new_features:
- **macOS sandbox** now allows access to `/var/folders/` and `/var/db/mds/` directories, resolving issues with `security` command and other macOS core tools ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/4797) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), fixes [#4389](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/4389) from 2020)
- Fixed **version-equivalent package rename bug** where packages like `pkg.00` renamed to `pkg.0` would be completely removed during `opam update` ([#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6774) by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk), fixes [#6754](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6754))
- **AppArmor profile installation** now checks for abi/4.0 support before installing, preventing failures on older Debian systems ([#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6764) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), fixes [#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763))
- Fixed **release tarball** vendored archive placement to correct location in `src_ext/archives` ([#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6765) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), fixes [#6762](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6762))
- **Windows build** fixes for release process by cleaning variables before calling make on different projects ([#6769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6769) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate))
- Added **OCaml 5.5 support** for building opam with dune dev profile ([#6670](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6670) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate))
latest_week.activity_summary: Major dependency change with cmdliner vendoring, 2.5.0-beta1 release preparation, OCaml 5.4/trunk CI additions
latest_week.activity:
- **cmdliner library vendored** as `opam-core.cmdliner` to avoid dependency conflicts with cmdliner 2.0.0, now wrapped and renamed to `OpamCmdliner` ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6755), [#6756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6756) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), fixes [#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425)), sparking discussion with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) about CLI stability versus feature evolution
- **2.5.0-beta1 release** in progress with PR opened ([#6787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6787) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)), awaiting final backports for dry-run fixes ([#6785](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6785), [#6788](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6788) by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou))
- **OCaml version support** expanded with 5.4 ([#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6732), [#6776](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6776)) and trunk ([#6684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6684)) added to CI test matrix by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
- **Documentation improvements** in progress for default compiler selection ([#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6778)) and compiler options installation ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6777)) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), addressing [#6407](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6407) and [#6645](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6645)
- Work continues on **dry-run mode fixes** to prevent directory creation during `opam switch create --dry-run` ([#6540](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6540) by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [#6565](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6565) by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou), fixes [#5918](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5918))
- **Version-equivalent package handling** improvements with cache invalidation issue identified and being addressed ([#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782), [#6783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6783) by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk))
- Long-standing **file-to-directory rename** issue being tackled with new PR for repository update handling ([#6779](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6779) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), addresses [#3830](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/3830) from 2019)
- **Performance work** with patch 3.1.0 update proposed for better diff handling ([#6772](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6772) by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate), requested by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm))
- **Stale directory cleanup** improvements for better UX when dealing with aborted switch creation ([#6735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6735) by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk), fixes [#5827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5827))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Debate over cmdliner vendoring decision between opam team and library author regarding CLI stability versus features
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **cmdliner vendoring decision** sparked discussion in [#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6755) where [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) (cmdliner author) argued for upgrading to 2.0.0 for better shell completion, while [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) and [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) prioritized CLI stability for opam 2.x series, ultimately proceeding with vendoring to avoid breaking changes
- **Fedora packaging strategy** discussed in [#6425](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6425) where distribution maintainers decided to use 2.5 beta instead of 2.4 backport for cmdliner compatibility
- **AppArmor abi version requirements** debated in [#6763](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6763), concluding that abi/4.0 is required minimum as abi/3.0 provides insufficient sandboxing
- **Platform-specific dependency installation** feature request in [#6773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6773) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) for `opam init --with-depexts`, concluded as too complex and better handled by system package managers
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on release stability, cross-platform compatibility, and addressing long-standing issues before 2.5 release
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Release preparation intensity** with 2.5.0-beta1 approaching, including extensive backporting to 2.5 branch ([#6756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6756), [#6770](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6770), [#6776](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6776), [#6784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6784), [#6786](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6786))
- **Long-standing issue resolution** with multiple 4+ year old bugs fixed, including macOS sandbox ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/4797) from 2021) and file-to-directory rename ([#6779](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6779) addressing [#3830](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/3830) from 2019)
- **OCaml version coverage expansion** with 5.4, 5.5, and trunk now tested in CI ([#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6732), [#6670](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6670), [#6684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6684)), ensuring forward compatibility
- **Cross-platform build reliability** improvements for Windows ([#6769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6769)), macOS ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/4797)), and Linux ([#6764](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6764))
- **Dependency management strategy** shifting toward vendoring for critical libraries to maintain stability ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6755))
- **Version equivalence handling** improvements to avoid edge cases with package version normalization ([#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6774), [#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782), [#6783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6783))
latest_week.issues_summary: One easy first issue available for stale directory cleanup UX improvement
latest_week.good_first_issues: - **opam switch remove should offer to clean up stale directories** - improve error messages and offer to remove leftover directories when switch creation is aborted ([#5827](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/5827), PR [#6735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6735) in progress by [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk))
latest_week.contributors_summary: Kate led with cmdliner vendoring and OCaml 5.5 support, R. Boujbel worked on dry-run fixes, arozovyk fixed version-equivalent package bugs
latest_week.contributors:
- [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) drove release preparation with cmdliner vendoring ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6755), [#6756](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6756)), OCaml 5.5 support ([#6670](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6670), [#6786](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6786)), CI improvements ([#6684](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6684), [#6732](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6732), [#6776](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6776)), macOS sandbox fix ([#4797](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/4797), [#6775](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6775)), release tarball fixes ([#6765](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6765), [#6766](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6766)), Windows build fixes ([#6769](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6769), [#6770](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6770)), documentation PRs ([#6777](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6777), [#6778](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6778)), and opened 2.5.0-beta1 release PR ([#6787](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6787))
- [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) worked on dry-run mode fixes ([#6788](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6788), [#6565](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6565)), AppArmor install script improvements ([#6760](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6760)), and provided reviews across multiple PRs
- [@arozovyk](https://github.com/arozovyk) fixed version-equivalent package rename bug ([#6774](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6774), [#6784](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6784)), identified cache invalidation issue ([#6782](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6782)), working on fix ([#6783](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6783)), and improving stale directory cleanup ([#6735](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6735))

- [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) engaged in technical discussion about cmdliner vendoring decision ([#6755](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/pull/6755)) and opened issues for opam init depexts feature ([#6773](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6773))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1 with bug fixes, improved Windows support, and enhanced release infrastructure
oldest_week.new_features_summary: First beta release of opam 2.3.0 with bug fixes and platform improvements across Linux, Windows, macOS, FreeBSD and OpenBSD
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Release of opam 2.3.0~beta1** with comprehensive bug fixes and platform support improvements ([2.3.0-beta1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/releases/tag/2.3.0-beta1))
- Fixed **VCS pinning regression** that stored untracked files in local VCS directories, resolving git submodule issues ([#6221](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6221))
- Fixed **platform compatibility** crash on OpenBSD where `getconf LONG_BIT` is unavailable ([#6230](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6230))
- Fixed **package cache corruption** storing wrong opam file versions after build failures ([#6213](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6213))
- Fixed **lint regression** W59 with local URLs that aren't archives ([#6219](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6219))
- **Enhanced Windows support** with fixes for OCaml 5.0+ compilation ([#6216](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6216))
- **Improved release infrastructure** including RISC-V Linux binary support and FreeBSD 14.1/OpenBSD 7.6 upgrades ([c7a1d9fc](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/c7a1d9fc0605f907ada31e165779995273dd5477), [7a78925110](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/7a78925110e0a6e005fc2c087d2fd0c7edf79a1a))
- **Updated install scripts** with 2.3.0~beta1 binary checksums for all supported platforms ([b600f1e88](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/b600f1e88f779db90fd2f57e911b749449e510f4))
- **New documentation CI job** added to GitHub Actions for automated doc generation and validation ([f48edffd](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/commit/f48edffd118e8e50e8211a199c559c77162e1318))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Week focused on release preparation and infrastructure improvements with team coordination between Kate and R. Boujbel
oldest_week.activity:
- **Release coordination** by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate) handling platform binary upgrades, release script improvements, and post-release documentation updates ([#6239](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6239))
- **Install script updates** by [R. Boujbel](https://github.com/rjbou) adding 2.3.0~beta1 binaries with proper SHA checksums for platform verification ([#6238](https://github.com/ocaml/opam/issues/6238))

latest_week.brief_summary: Performance improvements through lazy buffer indexing and optimized short-paths handling
latest_week.new_features_summary: Lazy buffer indexing delivers 25% speedup for error queries, short-paths optimizations reduce forced substitutions
latest_week.new_features:
- **Lazy buffer indexing** now only performs indexing when queries specifically require it ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), delivering approximately **25% speedup** for `ocamlmerlin single errors` queries as verified by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) in testing
- **Short-paths graph initialization** optimized by eliminating unnecessary forced substitutions ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)), improving performance particularly for projects using ppx_template and other ppx rewriters
- **Refactored index caching** mechanism removes imperative stamped hashtable in favor of clearer sharing-based approach ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)), better integrating with typer cache and enabling the lazy indexing implementation
- **Menhir parser generation** now uses `--lalr` flag ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)) for more optimal generated code, aligning with upstream OCaml compiler's parser configuration
latest_week.activity_summary: Performance-focused work with index caching refactoring, short-paths optimizations, and parser improvements
latest_week.activity:
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) refactored **index caching mechanism** replacing imperative stamped hashtable with sharing-based approach ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)), then implemented **lazy buffer indexing** that only indexes when queries require it ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), achieving 25% speedup on error queries
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimized **short-paths graph construction** by eliminating forced substitutions ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)) bringing improvements from oxcaml/merlin, and added **--lalr flag** to Menhir invocations ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)) for more optimal parser code generation
- **CI infrastructure** updated with Nix action bump from 31.7.0 to 31.8.2 ([#1986](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1986)), superseding earlier update attempt ([#1979](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1979))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Discussion on cache design led to lazy indexing implementation and performance validation
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) suggested making indexing lazy during review of index caching refactoring, prompting [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) to implement it as trivial follow-up ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990), [#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), with testing confirming ~25% speedup
- Menhir `--lalr` flag discussion revealed no immediate parser file changes in upstream Merlin despite causing changes in oxcaml/merlin ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)), likely due to Menhir version differences (20201216 vs 20231231) or grammar characteristics
- Short-paths optimization discussion noted uncertainty about performance impact ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)), with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) noting substitutions are more expensive in oxcaml due to ppx_template usage, and hypothesizing benefits primarily affect first typecheck before caching takes effect
latest_week.trends_summary: Cross-pollination with oxcaml/merlin bringing performance improvements, focus on lazy evaluation patterns
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-repository collaboration** between upstream Merlin and oxcaml/merlin continues with multiple performance improvements ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988), [#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)) flowing from oxcaml/merlin fork back to upstream, credited to suggestions from @let-def and @ccasin
- **Performance optimization focus** through lazy evaluation patterns, with both short-paths and buffer indexing moving to lazier implementations to avoid unnecessary work during queries
- **Cache architecture evolution** moving away from imperative stamped structures toward functional sharing-based designs that integrate more naturally with existing typer cache infrastructure
latest_week.contributors_summary: Three contributors delivered performance improvements with collaborative review and testing
latest_week.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implemented short-paths lazy evaluation ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988)) and Menhir LALR flag addition ([#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989)), reviewed index caching changes ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)), and provided performance testing results confirming 25% speedup from lazy indexing ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991))
- [Ulysse](https://github.com/voodoos) refactored index caching architecture ([#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990)) and implemented lazy buffer indexing ([#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991)), reviewed and merged contributions from [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) ([#1988](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1988), [#1989](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1989))
- [Charlène_Gros](https://github.com/Lucccyo) reported issue with locate command failing on multi-line type definitions ([#1987](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1987)) where environment is not properly set up when cursor is on definition

latest_week.brief_summary: Language committee governance refinements with new vote procedure PR and ongoing discussions on uniform arrays
latest_week.activity_summary: New PR on vote procedures, ongoing discussions on committee governance and uniform array proposal
latest_week.activity:
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) opened PR proposing **vote and consensus procedure** amendments for the OCaml Language Committee, emphasizing that voting should map opinions rather than resolve technical disagreements, with consensus as the primary goal ([#58](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/58))
- Ongoing **committee governance** discussions with [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) refining the **conflict of interest policy** to add transparency requirements, particularly around shared affiliations, with iterative improvements based on feedback from [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) about avoiding bias in technical judgment ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55))
- **Uniform array support** proposal by [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) continues with discussion about whether to support mutable or immutable uniform arrays, with [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) noting that type-disambiguated array literals would resolve syntax concerns ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/37))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Committee members debating nature of voting and consensus-building processes
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) contributed thoughtful analysis on how **voting drives consensus** in the committee, particularly for personal-taste matters, noting that votes help map preferences to build agreement, but technical content overrides vote results when parsing or implementation concerns emerge ([#58](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/58))
- Discussion on **conflict of interest** policy language with [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) suggesting focus on bias in "technical judgment" rather than "discussion" to better capture the core concern ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55))
- Debate about **uniform array design** with [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) raising questions about mutability requirements and array literal syntax compatibility ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/37))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on improving OCaml Language Committee governance processes and transparency
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Committee governance improvements** are receiving attention with two related PRs ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55), [#58](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/58)) aimed at clarifying decision-making processes, handling conflicts of interest, and establishing transparency norms for the OCaml Language Committee
- **Process over features** characterizes current RFC activity, with governance and procedural discussions taking precedence over new language feature proposals this week
latest_week.contributors_summary: Florian Angeletti driving committee governance improvements with Richard Eisenberg and Jeremy Yallop providing review feedback
latest_week.contributors:
- [Florian Angeletti](https://github.com/Octachron) authored two committee governance PRs on vote procedures ([#58](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/58)) and conflict of interest policy ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55)), responding to feedback and iterating on proposal language throughout the week
- [Richard Eisenberg](https://github.com/goldfirere) provided detailed commentary on the vote procedure PR, exploring the relationship between voting and consensus-building in committee decision-making ([#58](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/58))
- [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop) contributed review feedback on the conflict of interest policy, suggesting refinements to focus on bias in technical judgment ([#55](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/55))
- [Gabriel Scherer](https://github.com/gasche) maintains the uniform array proposal with ongoing discussion about design choices ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/37))
- [Olivier Nicole](https://github.com/OlivierNicole) and [Gaëtan Gilbert](https://github.com/SkySkimmer) participated in technical discussions on the uniform array RFC ([#37](https://github.com/ocaml/RFCs/issues/37))

latest_week.brief_summary: Discussion on UI improvements for code block rendering and module navigation
latest_week.activity_summary: Two ongoing issues received discussion about improving documentation rendering and navigation
latest_week.activity:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) provided guidance on **code block overflow** issue reported by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon), referencing a potential fix for long lines in code blocks that cause excessive page width ([#1389](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1389))
- Discussion on **module navigation** improvements continued, with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) explaining that odoc 3's global navigation feature enables tree view on ocaml.org, and suggesting dune rules need updating to use this feature in `dune build @doc` output ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1386))
latest_week.discussions_summary: Two UI/UX discussions about improving documentation display and navigation
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Code block rendering** discussion where [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) reported that long lines in code blocks cause the main content area to become too wide, forcing horizontal scrolling on the entire page ([#1389](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1389)). [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) shared a potential fix commit, though [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) suggested that a scrollbar within the code block would be preferable to wrapping
- **Navigation between sibling modules** discussed by [FrançoisT](https://github.com/francoisthire), who noted that navigating between modules with the same parent currently requires three clicks compared to Rustdoc's single-click experience ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1386)). [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) explained that odoc 3 includes global navigation feature providing tree view on ocaml.org, and that dune rules need updating to leverage this in local documentation builds
latest_week.contributors_summary: Jon Ludlam provided technical guidance on two UI improvement issues
latest_week.contributors:
- [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) responded to both active issues this week, providing technical context and potential solutions for code block rendering ([#1389](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1389)) and explaining the navigation capabilities available in odoc 3 ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1386))
- [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) reported the code block overflow issue and provided feedback on the proposed fix ([#1389](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1389))
- [FrançoisT](https://github.com/francoisthire) raised the module navigation issue comparing odoc's UX with Rustdoc ([#1386](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1386))

oldest_week.activity_summary: Three major PRs opened for index pages, sidebar overhaul, and frontmatter syntax plus active design discussions
oldest_week.activity:
- **Three new PRs opened** including index pages improvement by [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221)), sidebar and index overhaul by [Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac](https://github.com/panglesd) ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220)), and frontmatter syntax implementation ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Index page improvements** delivered through driver-generated package pages with library and module listings, addressing need for better navigation when handmade index pages don't exist ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Sidebar architecture** completely redesigned with unified tree representations across page, document, and unit sidebars, implementing smart content filtering that shows current page, ancestors, and siblings while avoiding overwhelming displays ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
- **Frontmatter syntax** development progressing with sexp-based approach for metadata like children order, short titles, and opens, though shifting toward existing `@-tags` syntax following [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli)'s recommendations ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Planning phase** launched for odoc 3.0 infrastructure with [Jon Ludlam](https://github.com/jonludlam) creating multiple issues covering opam metadata dependencies ([#1216](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1216)), markdown input support ([#1213](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1213)), deep sidebar JSON output ([#1214](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1214)), and driver compilation phases separation ([#1215](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1215))
oldest_week.discussions_summary: Detailed technical discussions on index page patterns, sexp syntax vs @-tags, and sidebar navigation design
oldest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Index page patterns** discussed by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) and [Emile Trotignon](https://github.com/EmileTrotignon) regarding automatically generated vs handmade pages, with emphasis on using section headings and `{!modules}` directives for better navigation ([#1221](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1221))
- **Syntax design debate** between sexp-based frontmatter and existing `@-tags` approach, with [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) advocating for consistency with existing ocamldoc language rather than importing new serialization formats ([#1210](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1210))
- **Sidebar behavior** examined by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) focusing on predictability and efficient use of horizontal space, suggesting separation of global content from unit-specific indexes ([#1220](https://github.com/ocaml/odoc/issues/1220))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on improving user experience through better navigation, standardizing metadata syntax, and planning infrastructure upgrades
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Navigation enhancement** priority with multiple parallel efforts on index pages, sidebar redesign, and hierarchical content organization aimed at making large documentation sets more accessible
- **Syntax standardization** movement toward leveraging existing ocamldoc `@-tags` rather than introducing new formats, emphasizing consistency with established language conventions
- **Infrastructure preparation** for odoc 3.0 with comprehensive planning covering opam integration, driver architecture, and compilation workflow improvements

- **Compilation target documentation** added covering all OCaml compilation modes: [native code](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (ocamlopt for high-performance production executables), [bytecode](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (ocamlc for fast development iteration), [JavaScript targets](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (Js_of_ocaml and Melange for web applications), [WebAssembly targets](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (wasm_of_ocaml and experimental Wasocaml), and [unikernels](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/commit/9648686c25e299fd9ef5edac7f15416c3be0f440) (MirageOS with Solo5, Unikraft, and Xen backends) with platform support details, use case guidance, and community resources ([#3378](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/3378))

oldest_week.new_features:
- Fixed **date format conversion** in event cards to use RFC 3339 format (ISO 8601) replacing `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM UTC` with `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MMZ` for proper JavaScript Date parsing ([#2782](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2782))
- Corrected **spelling standardization** across OCamlFormat changelog entries to use consistent "OCamlFormat" capitalization ([#2777](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2777))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Content publishing focused on opam beta release announcement and regular OCaml Planet blog updates
oldest_week.activity:
- **opam 2.3.0-beta1 announcement** published with comprehensive feature overview including new compiler management, enhanced dependency handling, and improved conflict resolution ([#2776](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2776))
- **OCaml Planet content** regularly updated with three automated scraping sessions adding new blog posts and videos from the community ([#2774](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2774), [#2775](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2775), [#2778](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2778))
- **Virtual event listings** expanded with two upcoming Reason OCaml India meetups for October covering advanced OCaml topics ([#2779](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2779))
- **Content fixes** included resolving duplicate wording on the front page identified by community feedback ([#2771](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2771))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on cross-platform support and technical infrastructure improvements
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Cross-platform development** emphasis with new Windows compilation support initiative launched as enhancement request ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
- **Technical infrastructure** improvements focusing on web standards compliance and date handling modernization
oldest_week.issues_summary: Windows compilation support available as help wanted enhancement request
oldest_week.good_first_issues: - **Windows compilation support** - investigate building ocaml.org on Windows platform, document issues, and implement necessary changes - labeled as enhancement, build-related, and help wanted ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780))
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Multiple contributors handled content updates, bug fixes, and community engagement
oldest_week.contributors:
- [sabine](https://github.com/sabine) implemented RFC 3339 date format fix for event cards ([#2782](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2782)) and standardized OCamlFormat spelling across changelog entries ([#2777](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2777))
- [Cuihtlauac Alvarado](https://github.com/cuihtlauac) created Windows compilation support enhancement request ([#2780](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2780)) and responded to community feedback on front page text corrections ([#2771](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2771))
- [Diogo Corigo](https://github.com/gsdiogocorigo) identified and reported duplicate wording issue on the website front page ([#2771](https://github.com/ocaml/ocaml.org/issues/2771))
- Automated systems maintained OCaml Planet content with regular blog post and video updates throughout the week

latest_week.brief_summary: Package ecosystem expansion with binaryen release series, new packages (flux, elpi, ppx_expect_nobase), and Centos/Fedora platform support improvements
latest_week.new_features_summary: New packages merged: flux streaming abstractions, elpi 3.4.3, ppx_expect_nobase testing framework, plus comprehensive binaryen/libbinaryen binding updates
latest_week.new_features:
- **Flux streaming library** ([#28804](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28804)) by [Calascibetta Romain](https://github.com/dinosaure) introduces composable streaming abstractions with Miou for concurrent programming
- **Elpi 3.4.3** ([#28832](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28832)) by [Enrico Tassi](https://github.com/gares) provides embeddable λProlog interpreter with updated language features and improved performance
- **ppx_expect_nobase 0.17.3.0** ([#28790](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28790)) by [Dmitrii Kosarev](https://github.com/Kakadu) delivers cram-like testing framework with stripped dependencies for lighter-weight testing
- **Binaryen bindings series** ([#28817](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28817), [#28819](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28819), [#28821](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28821), [#28822](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28822), [#28823](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28823), [#28824](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28824), [#28809](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28809)) by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) adds OCaml bindings for binaryen versions 0.28.0 through 0.31.0 and libbinaryen 122.0.0 through 124.0.0
- **Core library updates** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) including bytesrw 0.3.0 with cryptographic random module ([#28836](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28836)), logs 0.10.0 with mutex safety improvements ([#28838](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28838)), topkg 1.1.1 ([#28833](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28833)), and cmarkit 0.4.0 with CommonMark 0.31.2 support ([#28811](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28811))
- **QCheck 0.27** ([#28808](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28808)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) updates property-based testing framework across 4 packages
- **FFmpeg bindings 1.2.7** ([#28810](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28810)) by [Casey Reeves](https://github.com/xogium) provides updated bindings across 8 packages for multimedia processing
- **Centos platform support** expanded across multiple configuration packages ([#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28814), [#28828](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28828), [#28829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28829), [#28831](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28831)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding conf-ffmpeg, conf-python-3, conf-libgl, and conf-libglu support for Centos 9+ and Fedora 41+
latest_week.activity_summary: Pending releases include Melange 6.0.0, reason 3.17.1, Catala 1.0.0, Frama-C 32.0 beta, plus ongoing work on OCaml 5.4/5.5 system packages and Windows CI improvements
latest_week.activity:
- **Newly opened package submissions** include [Melange 6.0.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28866) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), [reason 3.17.1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28867) with printer improvements by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro), [Catala 1.0.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28853) law specification language by [Louis Gesbert](https://github.com/AltGr), [Frama-C 32.0~beta Germanium](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28842) with ANSI terminal support by [Basile Desloges](https://github.com/zilbuz), [acgtk 2.2.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28858) by [@Nyavlys](https://github.com/Nyavlys), [ctypes 0.24.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28855) by [Jeremy Yallop](https://github.com/yallop), [patch 3.1.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28854) with rope data structure by [Hannes Mehnert](https://github.com/hannesm), [qcaml 0.1.4](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28840) quantum computing library by [Elias](https://github.com/elias-utf8), [ansifmt 2.0.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28803) ANSI styling library by [lexa](https://github.com/qexat), [saltoIL 0.2.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28834) with when clause support by [Benoit Montagu](https://github.com/esope), [raven 1.0.0~alpha2](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28827) ML ecosystem meta-package by [Thibaut Mattio](https://github.com/tmattio), and [OCaml/Unikraft 1.1.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28750) with OCaml 5.4.0 support by [@shym](https://github.com/shym)
- **Additional binaryen updates** awaiting merge include libbinaryen patch releases ([#28859](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28859), [#28860](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28860), [#28861](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28861)) by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer), continuing the Grain language toolchain development
- **Package ecosystem additions** include [alice 0.1.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28863) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), [climate 0.8.7](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28862) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), [handlebars-ml 0.3.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28846) templating engine by [Kaustubh Maske Patil](https://github.com/nikochiko), [raga 0.1.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28847) static site generator by [Kaustubh Maske Patil](https://github.com/nikochiko), [stone 0.6.1](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28845) by [Armaël Guéneau](https://github.com/Armael), and [dkml-c-probe 3.2.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28864) cross-compiler ABI discovery by [@jonahbeckford](https://github.com/jonahbeckford)
- **Merged package updates** include bitstring 5.0.2 ([#28837](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28837)) by [Xavier R. Guérin](https://github.com/xguerin), directories 0.7 ([#28830](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28830)) by [@redianthus](https://github.com/redianthus), climate 0.8.6 ([#28839](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28839)) by [Stephen Sherratt](https://github.com/gridbugs), oplot 0.85 ([#28826](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28826)) mathematical plotting by [珊瑚](https://github.com/sanette), coq-waterproof 3.1.0+9.0 ([#28835](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28835)) by [@jim-portegies](https://github.com/jim-portegies), and fpath-base 0.4.0 ([#28807](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28807)) by [Mathieu Barbin](https://github.com/mbarbin)
- **Infrastructure and compatibility fixes** include ppxlib upper bounds for ocf_ppx and xtmpl_ppx ([#28852](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28852)) by [Marcello Seri](https://github.com/mseri), Windows constraint corrections ([#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28805)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid), git-net typo fix ([#28848](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28848)) by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid), odig b0 constraint relaxation ([#28792](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28792)) by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli), and solo5 duplicate field fix ([#28865](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28865)) by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w)
- **Frama-C ecosystem updates** include frama-c-metacsl 0.10~beta ([#28841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28841)) and frama-clang 0.0.19~beta ([#28843](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28843)) by [Frama-CI Bot](https://github.com/frama-ci-bot)
- **MLCUDDIDL OCaml 5.0 compatibility** work ([#28849](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28849)) by [François Bobot](https://github.com/bobot) removing modules to support newer runtime
- **Ongoing compiler tooling** includes [ocaml-system 5.4.0/5.5.0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28455) with dev/alpha/beta version matching by [Kate](https://github.com/kit-ty-kate)
latest_week.discussions_summary: Platform compatibility discussions focused on Windows CI failure handling, Centos/Fedora package dependencies, and opam metadata format issues
latest_week.notable_discussions:
- **Windows CI improvements** proposal ([#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28856)) by [@shym](https://github.com/shym) to implement `x-ci-accept-failures` handling in Windows CI tests matching other platforms, emerged from [OCaml/Unikraft work](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28750)
- **Unison Windows compatibility** ([#28851](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28851)) discussion by [Jacques-Henri Jourdan](https://github.com/jhjourdan) regarding host-system-msys conflicts and proper platform constraints, with input from [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) on correct Windows filtering syntax
- **Windows opam variable visibility** ([#28806](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28806)) merged by [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) adding opam variable printing to Windows workflows for better platform debugging
- **Opam metadata format** discussion ([#28865](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28865)) by [@art-w](https://github.com/art-w) identifying solo5 packages with duplicate `x-ci-accept-failures` fields causing opam2json errors
- **hilite optional dependency** ([#28857](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28857)) by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) clarifying cmarkit as optional dependency for hilite.markdown
latest_week.trends_summary: Centos/Fedora platform support expansion, binaryen ecosystem growth for Grain language, and infrastructure tooling improvements for CI and cross-platform builds
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Centos and Fedora platform support** emerged as focus area with [Jan Midtgaard](https://github.com/jmid) systematically addressing configuration package gaps across ffmpeg ([#28814](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28814), [#28828](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28828)), python ([#28829](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28829)), and OpenGL libraries ([#28831](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28831)) for Centos 9+ and Fedora 41+
- **Binaryen binding ecosystem** expansion by [Oscar Spencer](https://github.com/ospencer) with 10 PRs covering binaryen 0.28.0-0.31.0 and libbinaryen 122.0.0-124.0.1 supporting [Grain language](https://github.com/grain-lang) WebAssembly toolchain development
- **Core library maintenance** by [Daniel Bünzli](https://github.com/dbuenzli) with 5 package updates (bytesrw, logs, topkg, cmarkit, odig) addressing cryptographic random support, mutex safety, and CommonMark specification updates
- **Windows platform compatibility** improvements including constraint syntax corrections ([#28805](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28805)), CI test enhancements ([#28856](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28856)), and workflow variable visibility ([#28806](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28806))
- **OCaml 5.x ecosystem support** continuing with Unikraft 1.1.0 ([#28750](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28750)) adding OCaml 5.4.0 support, ocaml-system dev version matching ([#28455](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28455)), and MLCUDDIDL 5.0 compatibility work ([#28849](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28849))
- **Formal verification ecosystem** activity with Frama-C 32.0 beta ([#28842](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28842)), frama-clang ([#28843](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28843)), frama-c-metacsl ([#28841](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28841)), coq-waterproof ([#28835](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28835)), and Catala 1.0.0 ([#28853](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28853)) law specification language
- **Alternative frontend ecosystem** growth with Melange 6.0.0 ([#28866](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28866)) and reason 3.17.1 ([#28867](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/pull/28867)) by [Antonio Nuno Monteiro](https://github.com/anmonteiro) continuing JavaScript compilation toolchain development

oldest_week.brief_summary: Heavy week of package releases with 63 new packages added including major releases for YOCaml, opam 2.3.0 beta, and fixes for compiler installation issues
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New package releases for YOCaml static site generator, opam 2.3.0 beta, ActivityPub implementation, and Rust integration tools
oldest_week.new_features:
- **YOCaml static site generator** version 2.0.1 released with 12 comprehensive packages including markdown, YAML, Git integration, and multiple templating engines ([8965be0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/8965be0448d2eb507add00fc3c1b0c52ab4bcb60))
- **opam 2.3.0 beta1** released with 8 updated packages providing early access to new package manager features ([01638e0](https://github.com/ocaml/opam-repository/commit/01638e0884c6a8cafdcd39d6e21c947902d08b81))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Major architecture change removing wasm backend, improved sourcemap index support, and modernized runtime features
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend** (~32,000 lines of WASM-related code deleted), transforming the project back to pure JavaScript compilation ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Enhanced sourcemap support** with index mapping for linking multiple JS files together, improving debugging capabilities ([1e54c94](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1e54c943918016553ed2ba6cf75abe29596b8833), [a0a03bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a0a03bd67ecdf83a86350b9e5b391ceb39c9cf72), [6f38333](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6f38333b2e704a615afd7dca0aab101f68052f73))
- **Modern JavaScript runtime optimization** using static `Object.hasOwn` instead of dynamic property checks for better performance ([1bc3ab8](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1bc3ab8cde58915a35b4f2af59fae9c27f8dc392))
- **Improved weak reference handling** with complete runtime reimplementation for better memory management ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Global dead code elimination regression tests** added to prevent future issues ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067), [ebc6c4c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ebc6c4c00ccfede2fff6890e2f9c81b8b91bf5a8))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization
oldest_week.activity:
- **Complete architectural transformation** removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Documentation rewrite** completely updating README from wasm_of_ocaml focus to comprehensive js_of_ocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Runtime system modernization** across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Build system cleanup** removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Major simplification trend moving from dual JS/WASM targets to single JavaScript focus
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend consolidation strategy** with the project moving away from dual compilation targets (JavaScript + WebAssembly) to focus exclusively on JavaScript compilation, simplifying maintenance and development efforts
- **Modern JavaScript adoption** with runtime optimizations using current browser APIs like `Object.hasOwn` for improved performance and compatibility
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through improved sourcemap handling, particularly for complex linking scenarios involving multiple JavaScript files
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Limited activity with one feature request by Jérôme Vouillon and ongoing experimental work by hhugo

latest_week.brief_summary: Significant progress on modes, SIMD support, and Unix module annotations with 34 PRs merged and 17 new PRs opened.
latest_week.new_features_summary: F16C/FMA intrinsics, domain index API, TLS primitive, quiet flag for ocamldebug, and untagged char range patterns.
latest_week.new_features:
- **F16C and FMA SIMD intrinsics** added with new `Float16x8`, `Float16x16`, and `Float16x32` vector types for half-precision floating-point operations, plus fused multiply-add support ([#4964](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4964))
- **Domain index API** exposed via `Domain.self_index()` to get a unique integer identifier for the current domain, in range [0; N-1] where N is the peak number of simultaneously running domains ([#4950](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4950))
- **Thread-local storage primitive** `%tls_get` added for accessing thread-local state blocks, complementing the existing domain-local state ([#4959](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4959))
- **Untagged char range patterns** now supported (e.g., `#'a'..#'z'`) with improved match exhaustion checking for small integers and unboxed ints ([#4729](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4729))
- **Unix module local annotations** added to parameters in functions like `execv`, `execve`, `openfile`, `read`, `write`, `stat`, `lstat`, and many file operations to support locality modes ([#4830](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4830))
- **Quiet flag for ocamldebug** (`-quiet`) suppresses printing while executing initialization files, useful for cleaner startup in scripts ([#4869](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4869))
- **Locking scheme version** added to track runtime locking protocol changes ([#4958](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4958))
- **Stdlib local annotations** now printed for standard library functions to improve visibility of locality mode constraints ([#4943](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4943))
- **Hole expressions** (`Pexp_hole`) now parsed as simple expressions, improving error handling and type checking ([#4956](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4956))
- **Skiplist for natdynlink roots** in the runtime improves performance of dynamic linking ([#4949](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4949))
latest_week.activity_summary: 17 new PRs opened including SIMD enhancements and peephole optimizations, with 34 PRs merged covering modes, quotations, and tooling.
latest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include [#4987](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4987) and [#4988](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4988) for SIMD improvements (stop sign-extending small int casts, generalize memory operands), [#4982](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4982) for a new `sharable` mode, [#4983](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4983) to move `share_context` to mode hints, and several WIP PRs from [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) on **x86 peephole optimizations** ([#4973](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4973), [#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975), [#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977), [#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985))
- **Mode system improvements** were a major theme with [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) contributing [#4792](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4792) (convert mode to constant in cmi), [#4984](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4984) (disallow legacy mode syntax in comprehension), [#4968](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4968) (compiler no longer prints old mode/modality syntax), [#4979](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4979) (remove excessive parentheses in mode error hints), and [#4978](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4978) (add missing Skip hints for monadic modes)
- **Quotations and splicing** saw fixes with [Jakub Bachurski](https://github.com/jbachurski) landing [#4974](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4974) for inclusion checks with quotes and splices, [Leo White](https://github.com/lpw25) fixing quotation unification in [#4906](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4906), and [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) fixing constructor quotation locks in [#4910](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4910)
- **Compiler internals** improved with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) making module finding lazy in [#4970](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4970), [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) removing global state from Linkenv in [#4947](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4947), and [Luke Maurer](https://github.com/lukemaurer) fixing a segfault by disallowing aliases to parameter modules in [#4948](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4948)
- **Type system and jkinds** work included [Andrej Ivašković](https://github.com/Dreian) adding levels to sort variables in [#4785](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4785), [Dmitrii Kalinichenko](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) fixing `or_null` with default optional arguments in [#4953](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4953) and landing [#4891](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4891) for exceptions crossing statefulness and visibility
- **Documentation and tooling** updates included [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) fixing tutorial typos in [#4954](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4954) and [#4969](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4969), [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) rewording allocation hints in [#4957](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4957), and [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) restoring oxcaml-metrics push in [#4967](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4967)

latest_week.brief_summary: Performance improvements in short-paths construction, parser generation, and index caching
latest_week.new_features_summary: Performance optimizations for type-checking and parsing with lazy evaluation improvements
latest_week.new_features:
- **Short-paths graph construction** no longer forces expensive substitutions, addressing performance issues in large modules especially with ppx_template ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193)). This optimization affects `Env.update_short_paths` and improves type-checking and completion query performance by avoiding unnecessary work on large modules
- **Parser generation** now uses `--lalr` flag for menhir invocations, matching the compiler's configuration for improved parser performance ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194))
- **Index caching** refactored to use lazy evaluation, with the index buffer only computed when queries actually need it ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195)). Changes include replacing `Stamped_hashtable` with `Shape.Uid.Map.t` and making index computation on-demand
latest_week.activity_summary: Three performance-focused PRs merged addressing type-checking, parsing, and indexing bottlenecks
latest_week.activity:
- **Type-checking performance** improved by removing forced substitutions during short-paths graph construction by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), reducing overhead observed in real-world codebases where `ocamlmerlin single errors` took double the time compared to the compiler ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193))
- **Parser generation optimization** added `--lalr` flag to menhir invocations by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), aligning with the oxcaml compiler configuration ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194)). Credit to [Frédéric Bour](https://github.com/let-def) for identifying this improvement
- **Index computation** made lazy through backporting of upstream changes from [ocaml/merlin#1990](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1990) and [ocaml/merlin#1991](https://github.com/ocaml/merlin/issues/1991) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), eliminating unnecessary index buffer computation for queries that don't require it ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195))
latest_week.trends_summary: Focus on performance optimization through lazy evaluation and reducing unnecessary computation
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Lazy evaluation patterns** being applied across different subsystems (short-paths, indexing) to defer expensive computations until actually needed
- **Upstream backporting** from ocaml/merlin continuing to bring improvements to the oxcaml fork while maintaining compatibility
- **Performance profiling** driving targeted optimizations in areas where Merlin showed measurably worse performance than the compiler itself
latest_week.contributors_summary: Liam Stevenson authored all three PRs with reviews from dkalinichenko-js and Chris Casinghino
latest_week.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) implemented all three performance improvements this week: short-paths optimization ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193)), menhir `--lalr` flag addition ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194)), and lazy index computation ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) reviewed and approved the short-paths optimization ([#193](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/193)) and the lazy indexing changes ([#195](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/195))
- [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) reviewed and merged the menhir parser flag PR ([#194](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/194)), crediting [Frédéric Bour](https://github.com/let-def) for spotting the improvement opportunity

oldest_week.brief_summary: Enhanced locate command with context overrides and merged major OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 changes plus tooling improvements
oldest_week.new_features_summary: New `-context` flag for locate command enables precise namespace searching and automated magic number update script
oldest_week.new_features:
- Enhanced **locate command** with new `-context` flag allowing explicit namespace specification via values like `expr`, `module_path`, `type`, `constructor`, `label`, etc., overriding context inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- New **magic numbers update script** (`update-magic-numbers.sh`) for automated OCaml version compatibility maintenance, automatically syncing magic numbers from upstream OCaml flambda configuration ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- Fixed **EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive** handling for cmt/cms files, ensuring proper directory exclusion behavior during indexing ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- Improved **ghost location handling** in occurrences query by switching from ghost location filtering to `Location.none` filtering, better supporting let punning and PPX-generated code ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Multiple infrastructure improvements including OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 merge and cleanup of unused magic numbers
oldest_week.activity:
- **Locate command enhancement** completed by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) adding flexible context override capability for precise namespace searches, enabling users to specify exact identifier search contexts rather than relying on position inference ([#91](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/91))
- **OCaml 5.2.0minus-1 integration** delivered through comprehensive upstream merge by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), bringing latest flambda backend changes while temporarily deferring parameterized module support ([#106](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/106))
- **Development tooling improved** with new automated magic numbers update script by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), streamlining OCaml version compatibility maintenance with validation and error checking ([#108](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/108))
- **Code cleanup completed** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) removing unused magic numbers from configuration, reducing maintenance overhead and potential confusion ([#107](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/107))
- **Bug fix implemented** by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) for EXCLUDE_QUERY_DIR directive handling in cmt/cms files, with intention to upstream the fix to main OCaml merlin ([#104](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/104))
- **Occurrences query improvement** merged by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) switching from ghost location to `Location.none` filtering, coordinated with related [ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend#3137](https://github.com/ocaml-flambda/flambda-backend/issues/3137) changes ([#110](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/110))

oldest_week.emerging_trends:

- **Development automation** emphasis with creation of tooling for automated magic numbers maintenance, reducing manual overhead for OCaml version updates
